. The following lemma is an elementary fact in algebra which we will
use repeatedly. As one can easily find a proof in any algebra text book,we skip the proof
and let d be a divisor of n. Then the canonical group homomor-
\pi : ( \mathbb { Z } / n \mathbb { Z } ) ^ { \times } \to ( \mathbb { Z } / d \mathbb { Z } ) ^ { \times }

is surjective. Furthermore, this homomorphism splits. Namely, there exists a subgroup
